Articles.Content:
KSP is showing up at #10 #7 game this year according to http://www.multiplayerreviews.com/game-central#

Click on top 10 this year, and you\'ll see us at the bottom there.

This site is player chosen, so make sure to make an account and list your favorite games to be counted.
I\'ll be submitting my vote as soon as I can create an account

Just goes to show, you put something out there, it\'s as good as released alongside finished games.

Also: Yay! More recognition for KSP!

Yay!
#10th released this year moved to ANNO 2070. ,_,
KSP is getting pretty big. I didn\'t think it would spread this fast. I\'m happy for this.
Empire Earth III? Up there? Are you kidding me? That game was a disaster.

Empire Earth III? Up there? Are you kidding me? That game was a disaster.

well this is an new gamesrating site, and I don\'t trust any of the so...
Just submitted my vote in favor of KSP!

Empire Earth III? Up there? Are you kidding me? That game was a disaster.

Errmm... You might have read that wrong Empire Earth III is in the bottom third of all games on the site, that\'s not exactly up there.

KSP\'s already almost 300 ranks higher than it.

Edit: Just thought I\'d mention. I never heard of KSP before I saw it on multiplayerreviews.com. So thanks to who ever submitted it.

One of the owners of MultiPlayerReviews here. I discovered your game as it did make it into the user ranked top 10 games of this year.

I just want to start off by saying I did purchase a copy of your game this weekend as I think you have a great concept... It is Lego meets nerd

The reason I stopped in (and I will not link to it as I am not trying to link drop) is to let you know that we made your game a spotlight game a few min ago. So it should get a little more exposure now as I really think the Devs deserve the support.

Thanks again, and I look forward to the next update.

P.S. I did actually make it to the MUN and landed on it safely.... But I did not make it home..hahaha. SO I need more practice

Hello and welcome to the forum! Thanks for the spotlight, I am sure the devs will be grateful for any extra coverage the game receives - the more coverage, the more purchases, and the earlier we get a better game.
Make that #7 guys

...

It is Lego meets nerd

...

I like this description

One of the owners of MultiPlayerReviews here. I discovered your game as it did make it into the user ranked top 10 games of this year.

I just want to start off by saying I did purchase a copy of your game this weekend as I think you have a great concept... It is Lego meets nerd

The reason I stopped in (and I will not link to it as I am not trying to link drop) is to let you know that we made your game a spotlight game a few min ago. So it should get a little more exposure now as I really think the Devs deserve the support.

Thanks again, and I look forward to the next update.

P.S. I did actually make it to the MUN and landed on it safely.... But I did not make it home..hahaha. SO I need more practice

Indeed, a very large THANK YOU is in order.

And also, thanks for the really nice review! :thumbup:

Oh, and last but not least, welcome to the Community!

Cheers

One of the owners of MultiPlayerReviews here. I discovered your game as it did make it into the user ranked top 10 games of this year.

I just want to start off by saying I did purchase a copy of your game this weekend as I think you have a great concept... It is Lego meets nerd

The reason I stopped in (and I will not link to it as I am not trying to link drop) is to let you know that we made your game a spotlight game a few min ago. So it should get a little more exposure now as I really think the Devs deserve the support.

Thanks again, and I look forward to the next update.

P.S. I did actually make it to the MUN and landed on it safely.... But I did not make it home..hahaha. SO I need more practice

Although we all really like the publicity, just one question: Why is Sonic CD in the 'Released This Year Top 10'? I was under the impression that it was released in the late 90s.
number 5 now
WE\'RE NUMBER 1 7!

Wow. Number 5. I\'m voting for it.

Also, why\'s Dear Ester up there? It\'s not a game, it\'s a movie.
I just wrote a review for KSP on the MPR website. Hopefully the admins there approve and let it stand.

I think you have a great concept... It is Lego meets nerd

I don\'t think we can claim any copyrght on that. Lego itself has it since they started selling Mindstorms kits
Genre rank #4! Oh man! Get me an account!

It\'s pretty amazing that KSP has gotten this far up the list with just 32 people ranking it...

Shows how we support what we like

This is a pretty impressive concept for a review site, but I do find it distressing that games aren\'t divided into genres. I can easily say HL2 is one of the best FPS games ever, but I would also say Planescape Torment is the best RPG ever. Both deserve the number 1 spot, but only one can get it? Hmm...

EDIT: Wait, I see they\'re listed by genre and there\'s a \'genre rank\'... but it makes making the list really annoying if you have a lot of games on it. If I want to say Black and White 2 was the best \'god game\', I can\'t even see the genre in my list to ensure it\'s #1... so I\'d have it shuffled under 400 other games... mmm.
